item.title: Marissa add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "I wanted to change the world. But I have found that the only thing one can be sure of changing is oneself." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "I am burdened with what the Buddhists call the 'monkey mind' -- the thoughts that swing from limb to limb, stopping only to scratch themselves, spit and howl." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "Scientists are a friendly, atheistic, hard-working, beer-drinking lot whose minds are preoccupied with sex, chess and baseball when they are not preoccupied with science." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Marissa add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party." -- Nick Hornby
